objectModel.name: AviationSimNet
objectModel.purpose: For supporting human-in-the-loop air traffic management simulations.
objectModel.disclaimer: The contents reflect the views of the author and The MITRE Corporation and do not necessarily reflect the views of the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), the Department of Transportation (DOT), the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) or any other AviationSimNet partner. Neither the FAA, the DOT, NASA, nor other AviationSimNet partners make any warranty or guarantee, expressed or implied, concerning the content or accuracy of these views.

copyright.holder: The MITRE Corporation. All Rights Reserved.

attribute.name: privilegeToDelete
attribute.semantics: added to satisfy MAK parsing in an HLA-1.3 federate.

objectClass.name: aircraft
objectClass.semantics: Container for actual current aircraft state (non-sensored data). Not all attributes need to be populated.

attribute.name: uniqueID
attribute.semantics: Object identifier that uniquely identifies the aircraft object across the federation. This value can be used to reference a specific flight from other message attributes or parameters containing the ID.

attribute.name: flightID
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444 conventional ATC call sign or tail number identifying the flight. Does not need to be unique. Up to 8 characters, including null terminator.

attribute.name: tailNum
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444 identifier of the airframe used by the flight. Up to 8 characters, including null terminator.

attribute.name: aircraftType
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444/ICAO-8643 identifier of the aircraft equipment type. 2 to 4 characters, plus the null termimator.

attribute.name: wakeCategory
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444/ICAO-8643 wake category of the airframe. Valid values are 'H' for heavy, 'M' for medium, and 'L' for light.

attribute.name: engineType
attribute.semantics: FAA propulsion category of the airframe. Valid values are 'P' for propeller, 'T' for turboprop, or 'J' for jet.

attribute.name: latitude
attribute.semantics: current true latitude location of the flight. -90.0 (south pole) to +90.0 (north pole). This position is relative to the aircraft's center of mass.

attribute.name: longitude
attribute.semantics: current true longitude location of the flight. -180 (west of Prime Meridian) to +180 (east of Prime Meridian). Values greater than 360 can be reduced by multiples of 360. This position is relative to the aircraft's center of mass.

attribute.name: altitudeMSL
attribute.semantics: WGS-84 current true altitude measured above mean sea level. This position is relative to the aircraft's center of mass.

attribute.name: altitudeAGL
attribute.semantics: Current true altitude measured above ground level. This position is relative to the lowest part of the landing gear.

attribute.name: trueHeading
attribute.semantics: Current true orientation of the airframe in the horizontal plane perpendicular to the center of Earth. Measured from 0 (True North) clockwise to 360 (True North). This value is irrespective of the plane's path of motion.

attribute.name: pitch
attribute.semantics: Current pitch angle of the airframe relative to the horizontal plane. Measured from zero (parallel with the horizontal plane) to 180 (nose up), and from zero to -180 (nose down).

attribute.name: roll
attribute.semantics: Current roll angle of the airframe relative to the horizontal plane. Measured from zero (parallel with the horizontal plane) to 180 (left wing up), and from zero to -180 (right wing up).

attribute.name: groundTrack
attribute.semantics: Current tracking angle of the aircraft relative to the ground. Measured from zero (True North) clockwise to 360 (True North). In the absence of wind, this value would be identical to trueHeading.

attribute.name: groundSpeed
attribute.semantics: NAS-MD314 current true speed of the aircraft relative to stationary ground.

attribute.name: trueAirSpeed
attribute.semantics: NAS-MD314 current true airspeed of the aircraft relative to its airborne environment.

attribute.name: verticalSpeed
attribute.semantics: Current rate of change of altitude in feet per minute

attribute.name: landingGear
attribute.semantics: Percent to which the landing gear is in the engaged position. Valid values range from 0 (landing gear fully retracted up) to 100 (landing gear fully engaged down).

attribute.name: flaps
attribute.semantics: Current percentage of flaps deployed from 0 (flaps closed) to 100 (flaps open).

attribute.name: lights
attribute.semantics: A 2-byte bitfield of on/off status, where each bit represents a lighting system on the aircraft, where 1 indicates 'on' and 0 indicates 'off', according to the following structure, from least significant bit (0), to most significant bit (15): beacon, navigation, strobe, wing, logo, left runway turnoff, right runway turnoff, unused, left outboard landing, right outboard landing, left inboard landing, right inboard landing, and nose landing.

attribute.name: addrModeS
attribute.semantics: Unique 6 hexadecimal digit SSR address identifying the aircraft in a radar environment. The value is stored in the 24 least significant bits. The remaining high bits are unused.

attribute.name: airborne
attribute.semantics: Current status of being on ground (0) or airborne (1).

attribute.name: ssrMode
attribute.semantics: Current transponder mode.

attribute.name: beaconCode
attribute.semantics: NAS-MD313 Beacon code ranging from 0000 to 7777 (octal) or 4095 (decimal).

attribute.name: timestampSeconds
attribute.semantics: Logical time at which the the accompanying attributes are valid. The publisher must use current logical time. The subscriber can use the timestamp to make adjustments as to when the aircraft truly had these values in the local time context. Measured in seconds since Midnight GMT, 1/1/1970.

attribute.name: timestampMilliseconds
attribute.semantics: Portion of the update timestamp representing the number of milliseconds appended to the timestampSeconds for additional accuracy. Publishing or subscribing this attribute is useless without the timestampSeconds attribute.

attribute.name: equipage
attribute.semantics: ICAO string of characters describing communications and navigation capabilities of the airframe. Two classes of equipage are specified, separated by a slash '/'. Preceding the slash, the indicators are as follows (N) if no equipment for the route to be flown is carried, or the equipment is unserviceable, (S) if standard COM/NAV equipment for the route to be flown is carried and serviceable, (A) LORAN A, (C) LORAN C, (D) DME, (E) EGWPS, (F) Not implemented yet, (G) GPS /GNSS, (H) HF RTF, (I) INS (Inertial navigation), (J) Data link, (K) MLS, (L) CDTI (Cockpit Display of Traffic Information), (M) Omega, (O) PDS (Pair Dependent Spacing), (P) Doppler, (R) RNAV/RNP/RNPC, (T) TACAN, (U) UHF RTF, (V) Autonomous Operation Planner, (W) RVSM, (X) MNPS, (Y) CMNPS, (Z) other. Following the slash the indicators are as follows for describing the serviceable SSR equipmnet: (N) Nil, (A) Transponder Mode A, (C) transponder mode A and mode C, (D) ADS-B, (X) transponder mode S without pressure altitude or aircraft identification transmission, (P) transponder mode S with pressure altitude but without aircraft identification transmission, (I) transponder mode S without pressure altitude but with aircraft identification transmission, (S) transponder mode S with both pressure and aircraft identification transmission.

objectClass.name: Flight
objectClass.semantics: Not all attributes need to be populated (scenario dependent).

attribute.name: uniqueID
attribute.semantics: Object identifier that corresponds to the aircraft object associated with this flight.

attribute.name: flightID
attribute.semantics: Semantics: ICAO-4444 conventional ATC call sign or tail number identifying the flight. Does not need to be unique. Up to 8 characters, including null terminator.

attribute.name: tailNum
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444 identifier of the airframe used by the flight. Up to 8 characters, including null terminator.

attribute.name: numberOfAircraft
attribute.semantics: The number of aircraft in the flight or formation. This corresponds to NAS Field 03a, and to ICAO Field 09a.

attribute.name: aircraftType
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444/ICAO-8643 identifier of the aircraft equipment type. 2 to 4 characters, plus the null termimator.

attribute.name: wakeCat
attribute.semantics: ICAO-4444/ICAO-8643 wake category of the airframe.

attribute.name: equipage
attribute.semantics: [refer to aircraft object equipage attribute.]

attribute.name: proposedDepartureTime
attribute.semantics: The time a proposed flight is scheduled to depart. It corresponds to NAS Field 07 (if a P-time) and ICAO Field 13b.

attribute.name: actualDepartureTime
attribute.semantics: The actual time (UTC) at which an active flight has departed.

attribute.name: holdData
attribute.semantics: Hold details for a flight currently in Hold or with a future Hold defined.

attribute.name: holdType
attribute.semantics: hold state of the flight. Use in tandem with holdFix.

attribute.name: holdFix
attribute.semantics: Where the aircraft is or will be in hold. May be in lat/long or fix radial distance format.

attribute.name: holdFixCoordLat
attribute.semantics: The latitude associated with the hold fix. -90.0 (south pole) to +90.0 (north pole).

attribute.name: holdFixCoordLong
attribute.semantics: The longitude associated with the hold fix. -180 (west of Prime Meridian) to +180 (east of Prime Meridian).

attribute.name: entryTime
attribute.semantics: When the aircraft went into or will go into hold.

attribute.name: exitTime
attribute.semantics: When the aircraft is scheduled to exit from the hold.

attribute.name: flightState
attribute.semantics: The Flight Activation State.

attribute.name: routeString
attribute.semantics: The route string initially consisting of the filed route for the flight. It contains a collection of fix elements, delimiters and route elements in NAS route string format. An item in the route string may be entered as an element of the flight plan or it can be associated with automatically applied routes from updates to the filed route of flight. When used as the latter, it corresponds to NAS W-Key elements. When used as the former, corresponds to NAS field 10.

attribute.name: controllerText
attribute.semantics: Other text entered by the controller to be associated with the Clearance.

attribute.name: assignedHeading
attribute.semantics: The Clearance heading in degrees.

attribute.name: assignedSpeed
attribute.semantics: The speed assigned to the flight by the controller. Speed can be supplied as either a mach value or a true airspeed. The Assigned Speed attribute is treated similarly to the Assigned Altitude when control of a flight is transferred from one facility to another. Valid content for this field is: (S)dd(d)(d) = Filed true airspeed in knots. The four digits of filed true airspeed in knots cannot exceed 3700. The S is required if the input is from R-position console unless the Category Keys/Category Function Keys are used. In the latter case and in all non-Rposition console entries, the S must be omitted. SC = Classified speed. When SC is input, its equivalent numeric speed is in adaptation. Mddd = Filed MACH speed. Filed MACH speed can not exceed M500.

attribute.name: assignedAltitude
attribute.semantics: The altitude assigned by the controller. It is the altitude at which a receiving facility should assume the flight has been cleared at transfer time. Data is optional in that it is never present in a proposed plan and always present in an active plan (except for a Tentative plan, where it is optional). It is also referred to as Coordinated Altitude. Assigned Altitude corresponds to NAS Field 08/ICAO Field 15b.

attribute.name: requestedAltitude
attribute.semantics: The altitude requested in a proposed flight plan. It corresponds to NAS Field 09/ICAO Field 15b.

attribute.name: interimAltitude
attribute.semantics: The current interim altitude in feet for the flight if one is assigned.

attribute.name: coordFix
attribute.semantics: The fix at which flight is coordinated into this facility. The fix is passed from the previous ATC facility along with a time estimate of when the flight will reach the fix. For ICAO routes, this item is blank if the flight is an internal departure. It is determined from the Route if the flight is an external departure (not from within the local facility's airspace). Typically, this fix is the departure airport for non-ICAO internal departures.

attribute.name: coordTime
attribute.semantics: Related to the CoordinationFix attribute. It is the UTC estimated time at which a flight will be at the coordination fix. If the time is input as xxdd, indicating a time offset, the current time will be added to the dd before the information is saved here. This value is in NAS Field 07 (if an E-time, P-time, D-time) and in ICAO Field 14b where Field 14a is the coordination fix.

attribute.name: beaconCode
attribute.semantics: Semantics: NAS-MD313 Beacon code ranging from 0000 to 7777 (octal) or 4095 (decimal).

attribute.name: originAirport
attribute.semantics: The airport fron which the flight departs.

attribute.name: destinationAirport
attribute.semantics: The airport where the flight will land. It corresponds to NAS Field 10, last element or ICAO Field 16a. The value represents a Non-Standard Destination Airport if ICAO Field 16a contains ZZZZ.

attribute.name: flightType
attribute.semantics: FlightType contains the activity category for the flight.

attribute.name: flightRule
attribute.semantics: The current applicable flight rule. FlightRule determines the rules by which a flight is operating.

attribute.name: estTimeOfArrival
attribute.semantics: The ETA, or Estimated Time of Arrival, specifies the estimated UTC time when the flight is expected to arrive at its destination based on the actual time of departure and the Estimated Time Enroute (ETE). The ETA replaces the ETE when the flight departs. An ETA may be received suffixed to the destination within the route of an active flight plan, or may be calculated.

attribute.name: inDelay
attribute.semantics: This attribute contains a Boolean value indicating whether the flight is currently in delay.

attribute.name: updateSource
attribute.semantics: Identifies the message type designator (NAS Field 01, ICAO Field 03a) and the source (NAS Field 00, and ICAO Field 03b, 03c) including an optional Sector/Position ID and Transaction Number for a message that updates the flight data. The sector/position/transaction information is supplied only if it is applicable for the originating facility to do so.

attribute.name: remarks
attribute.semantics: Intrafacility remarks stored in the Flight Object consist of up to 21 text characters, as entered by the controller. If present, the 21st character must be the '+' character indicating intra-facility remarks truncation has occurred. The overcast weather symbol preceding Intrafacility remarks are not included in the 21 characters of stored remarks text.

attribute.name: timestampSeconds
attribute.semantics: time at which this Flight object was last updated by the publisher.

attribute.name: timestampMilliseconds
attribute.semantics: 1000ths of a second refining the timestamp this flight object was last updated by the publisher.

objectClass.name: Radio
objectClass.semantics: A radio object that maintains state, typically in accordance with the Radio Entity being used in the AviationSimNet voice network.

attribute.name: primaryFrequency
attribute.semantics: The current primary (active) frequency in MHz this radio is tuned to.

attribute.name: standbyFrequency
attribute.semantics: The current standby (backup) frequency in MHz this radio is tuned to, if any.

attribute.name: ownerID
attribute.semantics: The uniqueID of the owning object for this radio. If this radio is in an aircraft, then use the Aircraft.uniqueID value.

attribute.name: description
attribute.semantics: Free description of this Radio and what it's used for.

attribute.name: monitor
attribute.semantics: Indicator if this radio is currently being used to monitor the frequency.

attribute.name: transmit
attribute.semantics: Indicator if this radio should transmit if PTT/VOX is pressed.

attribute.name: type
attribute.semantics: The frequency band this Radio can tune.

interactionClass.name: StartSimTime
interactionClass.semantics: Notification that the simulation authority has defined a common logical time for all federates to set their internal clocks prior to time advancement.

parameter.name: timeSeconds
parameter.semantics: Seconds since midnight GMT 01/01/1970.

interactionClass.name: Shutdown
interactionClass.semantics: Notification from the simulation authority that the simulation should be terminated immediately.

interactionClass.name: Pause
interactionClass.semantics: Trigger message to halt simulation time advancement. Available for the sake of federates who are not otherwise involved with time management.

interactionClass.name: Resume
interactionClass.semantics: Trigger to indicate that the simulation clock is starting. Will be sent at least once at the start of the simulation, and other times, only after a Pause message has been sent.

interactionClass.name: WxRequestRUC
interactionClass.semantics: A request that the publisher of RUC data sends a WxNotifyRUC interaction satisfying the parameters of the request. Bounding box parameters are only used if requesting a specific subset of the RUC observation.

parameter.name: gridID
parameter.semantics: The NCDC grid used for the RUC model.

parameter.name: timeSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the model is run. Omit to request the current model run.

parameter.name: type
parameter.semantics: Type of RUC requested.

parameter.name: latitudeMin
parameter.semantics: Bounding box minimum latitude requested.

parameter.name: latitudeMax
parameter.semantics: Bounding box maximum latitude requested.

parameter.name: longitudeMin
parameter.semantics: Bounding box minimum longitude requested.

parameter.name: longitudeMax
parameter.semantics: Bounding box maximum longitude requested.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request

interactionClass.name: WxNotifyRUC
interactionClass.semantics: A notification of a new RUC file, either in response to a WxRequestRUC, or to indicate a new RUC model has been generated. If responding to a request, the bounding parameters are repeated as requested.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.semantics: The location of the RUC file.

parameter.name: gridID
parameter.semantics: The NCDC grid used for the RUC model.

parameter.name: timeSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the model was run.

parameter.name: type
parameter.semantics: Type of RUC model.

parameter.name: latitudeMin
parameter.semantics: Bounding box minimum latitude.

parameter.name: latitudeMax
parameter.semantics: Bounding box maximum latitude.

parameter.name: longitudeMin
parameter.semantics: Bounding box minimum longitude.

parameter.name: longitudeMax
parameter.semantics: Bounding box maximum longitude.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: Included only if this message is in response to a WxRequestRUC.

interactionClass.name: WxRequestPointRUC
interactionClass.semantics: A request that the publisher of RUC data sends a WxNotifyPointRUC interaction. The request must include all parameters, except specify either altitudeMSL or pressureLevel.

parameter.name: gridID
parameter.semantics: The NCDC grid used for the RUC model.

parameter.name: timeSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time of the requested model run. Omit to request the current model run.

parameter.name: type
parameter.semantics: Flag for interpolation.

parameter.name: latitude
parameter.semantics: Requested latitude of the RUC point.

parameter.name: longitude
parameter.semantics: Requested longitude of the RUC point.

parameter.name: altitudeMSL
parameter.semantics: Requested altitude of the RUC point.

parameter.name: pressureLevel
parameter.semantics: Requested pressure level of the RUC point.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID.

interactionClass.name: WxNotifyPointRUC
interactionClass.semantics: A response to a WxRequestPointRUC interaction.

parameter.name: temperature
parameter.semantics: The observed RUC temperature at the point (kelvin degrees).

parameter.name: pressure
parameter.semantics: The observed RUC pressure at the point (pascals).

parameter.name: windU
parameter.semantics: The observed RUC U component of the wind at the point (meters/second).

parameter.name: windV
parameter.semantics: The observed RUC V component of the wind at the point (meters/second).

parameter.name: gridID
parameter.semantics: The NCDC grid used for the RUC model.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the observation was valid.

parameter.name: type
parameter.semantics: Type of observation point.

parameter.name: latitude
parameter.semantics: The actual latitude associated with this point. May be different from request if interpolation was on.

parameter.name: longitude
parameter.semantics: The actual longitude associated with this point. May be different from request if interpolation was on.

parameter.name: altitudeMSL
parameter.semantics: The actual altitude associated with this point. May be different from request if interpolation was on.

parameter.name: pressureLevel
parameter.semantics: The actual pressure level associated with this point. May be different from request if interpolation was on.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request

interactionClass.name: WxRequestNEXRAD-II
interactionClass.semantics: A request that the publisher of NEXRAD level II data sends a WxNotifyNEXRAD-II interaction. The request must specify either the mosaicID or radarID parameter, but not both.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time of the desired NEXRAD-II data. Omit to request the latest available NEXRAD-II.

parameter.name: mosaicID
parameter.semantics: Mosaic identifier.

parameter.name: radarID
parameter.semantics: Radar site identifier.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request

interactionClass.name: WxNotifyNEXRAD-II
interactionClass.semantics: A notification of a new level II NEXRAD (Next Generation Radar) file, either in response to a WxRequestNEXRAD-II, or to indicate a new NEXRAD-II observation has been made.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.semantics: The location of the level II NEXRAD file

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the observation was made

parameter.name: mosaicID
parameter.semantics: Mosaic identifier. (what is the reference set of identifiers?)

parameter.name: RadarID
parameter.semantics: Radar site identifier. (what is the reference set of identifiers?)

parameter.name: radarLat
parameter.semantics: Latitude location of the radar

parameter.name: radarLon
parameter.semantics: Longitude location of the radar

parameter.name: radarElevationMSL
parameter.semantics: WGS-84 elevation (feet) of the radar measured relative to mean sea level.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request, if responding to a WxRequestNEXRAD message.

interactionClass.name: WxRequestNEXRAD-III
interactionClass.semantics: A request that the publisher of level III NEXRAD data sends a WxNotifyNEXRAD-III interaction. The request must specify either the mosaicID or radarID parameter, but not both.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time of the desired level III NEXRAD data. Omit to request the latest available NEXRAD-III.

parameter.name: product
parameter.semantics: The type of NEXRAD-III product being requested.

parameter.name: mosaicID
parameter.semantics: Requested mosaic sector

parameter.name: radarID
parameter.semantics: Radar site identifier.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request

interactionClass.name: WxNotifyNEXRAD-III
interactionClass.semantics: A notification of a new level III NEXRAD (NEXRAD Information Dissemination System) file, either in response to a WxRequestNEXRAD-III, or to indicate a new NEXRAD-III observation has been made.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.semantics: The location of the level III NEXRAD file

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the observation was made.

parameter.name: product
parameter.semantics: The type of NEXRAD product observation.

parameter.name: mosaicID
parameter.semantics: Requested mosaic sector

parameter.name: radarID
parameter.semantics: Radar site identifier.

parameter.name: radarLat
parameter.semantics: Latitude location of the radar

parameter.name: radarLon
parameter.semantics: Longitude location of the radar

parameter.name: radarElevationMSL
parameter.semantics: WGS-84 elevation (feet) of the radar measured relative to mean sea level.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request, if responding to a WxRequestNEXRADIII message.

interactionClass.name: WxRequestMETAR
interactionClass.semantics: A request that the publisher of METAR (Meteorological Aviation Report) data sends a WxNotifyMETAR interaction.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time of the desired NEXRAD data. Omit to request the latest available NEXRAD

parameter.name: station
parameter.semantics: The weather station ID generating the METAR.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request

interactionClass.name: WxNotifyMETAR
interactionClass.semantics: A notification of a new METAR report, either in response to a WxRequestMETAR, or to indicate a new METAR observation has been made.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time at which the METAR was reported.

parameter.name: station
parameter.semantics: The weather station ID that generated the METAR.

parameter.name: text
parameter.semantics: The text of the METAR.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request, if responding to a WxRequestMETAR message.

interactionClass.name: WxRequestError
interactionClass.semantics: If the publisher of weather cannot respond to a request, it should send this error message, so that the requesting federates are notified of the error.

parameter.name: timestampSeconds
parameter.semantics: Logical time the error was generated.

parameter.name: requestType
parameter.semantics: The type of request this error relates to.

parameter.name: errorMessage
parameter.semantics: A human-readable error message describing the error.

parameter.name: requestUniqueID
parameter.semantics: The unique ID associated with the request.

transportation.name: HLAreliable
transportation.description: Provide reliable delivery of data in the sense that TCP/IP delivers its data reliably

transportation.name: HLAbestEffort
transportation.description: Make an effort to deliver data in the sense that UDP provides best-effort delivery

basicData.name: HLAinteger16BE
basicData.encoding: 16-bit two's complement signed integer. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAinteger32BE
basicData.encoding: 32-bit two's complement signed integer. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAinteger64BE
basicData.encoding: 64-bit two's complement signed integer first. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAfloat32BE
basicData.encoding: 32-bit IEEE normalized single-precision format. See IEEE Std 754-1985

basicData.name: HLAfloat64BE
basicData.encoding: 64-bit IEEE normalized double-precision format. See IEEE Std 754-1985

basicData.name: HLAoctetPairBE
basicData.encoding: Assumed to be portable among hardware devices.

basicData.name: HLAinteger16LE
basicData.encoding: 16-bit two's complement signed integer. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAinteger32LE
basicData.encoding: 32-bit two's complement signed integer. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAinteger64LE
basicData.encoding: 64-bit two's complement signed integer first. The most significant bit contains the sign.

basicData.name: HLAfloat32LE
basicData.encoding: 32-bit IEEE normalized single-precision format. See IEEE Std 754-1985

basicData.name: HLAfloat64LE
basicData.encoding: 64-bit IEEE normalized double-precision format. See IEEE Std 754-1985

basicData.name: HLAoctetPairLE
basicData.encoding: Assumed to be portable among hardware devices.

basicData.name: HLAoctet
basicData.encoding: Assumed to be portable among hardware devices.

basicData.name: UnsignedShort
basicData.encoding: 16-bit unsigned integer. (WARNING: unsigned integers are not directly supported by JAVA).

basicData.name: UnsignedLong
basicData.encoding: 32-bit unsigned integer. (WARNING: unsigned integers are not directly supported by JAVA).

simpleData.name: HLAASCIIchar
simpleData.semantics: Standard ASCII character (see ANSI Std x3.4-1986

simpleData.name: HLAunicodeChar
simpleData.semantics: Unicode UTF-16 character (see The Unicode Standard, Version 3.0)

simpleData.name: HLAfederateHandle
simpleData.semantics: The type of the argument to Normalize Federate Handle service. This is a pointer to an RTI-defined programming language object, not an integer 32

simpleData.name: HLAfederateHandle
simpleData.semantics: The type of the argument to the Normalize Federate Handle service. This is a pointer to a RTI defined programming language object, NOT an integer 32.

simpleData.name: ASNflightAltitude
simpleData.semantics: (d)dd = altitude or flight level (a three digit number assumed to have two zeros following). OTP = VFR-on-top. OTP(d)dd = VFR-on-top plus an altitude. ABV(d)dd = Flight operating above specified altitude. (d)ddB(d)dd = A block of altitude or flight levels. VFR = VFR. VFR(d)dd = VFR plus an altitude. Lddd where L is F or A (flight level or altitude). LdddBddd where F indicates both altitudes are flight level numbers and A indicates both altitudes are in hundreds of feet. The B indicates blocked altitudes.

simpleData.name: ASNdegrees
simpleData.semantics: WGS-84 latitude or longitude position on the Earth

enumeratedData.name: ASNwakeType
enumeratedData.semantics: ICAO-4444/ICAO-8643 wake category of an airframe

enumeratedData.name: ASNengineType
enumeratedData.semantics: FAA propulsion category of the airframe

enumerator.name: Trial (Active): Plan for an active flight that was created to investigate the consequences of replacing the current active Plan with the Trial Plan. Consequences could include, for example, aircraft-to-aircraft or aircraft-to-airspace conflict or excessive sector demand.

Pending (Proposed): Plan with a departure time that is less than or equal to an adaptable time in the future. When the departure time is delayed, an additional parameter specifies the time duration (expressed as hhmm) in advance of the Estimated Departure Clearance Time (EDCT) at which a flight object with a proposed plan will transition from Planned to Pending Flight Activation State. Nominally, a plan is Pending when the departure time is within a half hour of the current time.

Enroute (Active): A flight can be activated by the entry of an amendment (AM) message, an Estimate (EST) message, a Departure Request (DM), or upon receipt of updated flight data from an upstream center. At the time of the flight's activation, the flight enters the En Route Flight Activation state, remaining in that state until the flight is put into Hold or until it arrives at its destination, where it enters the Landing Flight Activation state.

Landing (Active): If the Flight Plan Latest Position reaches the last converted fix in the route and the last converted fix is an adaptable airport within center airspace OR if a Terminate Beacon Code request is accepted for that flight from a facility that uses the ARTS interface and that contains the destination airport, then the flight enters the Landing Flight Activation state.

Hold (Active): A flight can be assigned to a Present Position Hold, where it immediately enters the Hold Flight Activation State, or to a Future Hold, where it remains in the En Route Flight Activation State until it either reaches the Future Hold fix, or the trajectory-time-at-fix position occurs, whichever is first.

enumeratedData.name: ASNflightType
enumeratedData.semantics: Designations corresponding to ICAO Flight Plan Field 08b.

enumerator.name: Aircraft will be in hold in the future at the designated hold fix
Surface Rainfall Accumulation, 1 Hour Precipitation total
Surface Rainfall Accumulation, Storm Total Precipitation

enumeratedData.name: ASNnexrad3MosaicSector
enumeratedData.semantics: Standardized NWS national and regional Mosaic sectors.

enumeratedData.name: HLAresignAction
enumeratedData.semantics: Action to be performed by RTI in conjunction with resignation

enumeratedData.name: HLAorderType
enumeratedData.semantics: Order type to be used for sending attributes or interactions

arrayData.name: HLAhandle
arrayData.semantics: Encoded value of a handle. The encoding is based on the type of handle

arrayData.name: HLAtransportationName
arrayData.semantics: String whose legal value shall be name from and row in the OMT Transportation Table (IEEE P1516.2)

arrayData.name: HLAlogicalTime
arrayData.semantics: An encoded logical time. An empty array shall indicate that the value is not defined

arrayData.name: HLAtimeInterval
arrayData.semantics: An encoded logical time interval. An empty array shall indicate that the value is not defined

arrayData.name: HLAobjectClassBasedCounts
arrayData.semantics: List of counts of various items based on object class

arrayData.name: HLAsyncPointList
arrayData.semantics: List of names of synchronization points

arrayData.name: HLAsyncPointFederateList
arrayData.semantics: List of joined federates and the syncronization status of each

fixedRecordData.name: HLAobjectClassBasedCount
fixedRecordData.semantics: Object class and count of associated items

fixedRecordData.name: HLAinteractionCount
fixedRecordData.semantics: Count of interactions of a class

fixedRecordData.name: HLAsyncPointFederate
fixedRecordData.semantics: A particular joined federate and its synchronization point status

field.name: HLAfederateSyncStatus
field.semantics: Synchronization status of the particular joined federate
